availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Hite (Nelson County, Kentucky, representative and attorney)

body.p: Nelson County, Kentucky, representative and attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Mary A. Hite. Father of Thomas M. Hite and Rhoda Hite Sheridan. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Nelson County from 1848 to 1849. Attorney in Nelson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned eight enslaved persons in Nelson County in 1850. Attorney in Jefferson County in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 2, p. 389A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 2, p. 236.

Journal of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky (1848), vol. 2, December 30, 1848 - February 28, 1849, (Frankfort: A. C. Hodges & Co, 1849), 5.
